result.reason: The current CSV import functionality is storage-provider agnostic and should work with SQL Server via the connection tree; clarification is needed on whether the user is reporting a specific bug/failure with this workflow or requesting a separate direct-to-database import tool.
result.approach: Investigate existing import behavior with SQL provider and request reproduction steps or specific requirements from the user.

attempts.raw_output:
I will search for import-related files and usage of "CSV" to understand the current import capabilities and how they might interact with MS SQL storage.
I will read `mRemoteNG\Config\Import\MRemoteNGCsvImporter.cs` and `mRemoteNG\App\Import.cs` to understand how the CSV import logic is implemented and how it interacts with the connection storage, specifically to see if there are any obvious limitations regarding SQL Server.
I will list the contents of `mRemoteNG\Config\DataProviders\` to see if there are any SQL-specific data providers or import logic that might be relevant.
I will read `mRemoteNG\Config\DataProviders\SqlDataProvider.cs` to understand how it handles saving data and if it supports standard tree manipulation events for creating new nodes.
I will search for usages of `ImportFromFile` in the codebase to see if the "Import" menu item or functionality is conditionally disabled or restricted when using the SQL provider.
